com.slightlyloony.blog.util

Class ID

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slightlyloony.blog.util.ID

  • public class ID
extends java.lang.Object
    Static container class for utilities related to IDs. These use base64url encoding as defined by RFC 4648.
    Author:
    Tom Dilatush tom@dilatush.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int compare(char _a, char _b)
      Returns -1, 0, or +1 as the given base64url character _a is less than, equal to, or greater than the given base64url character _b, using the base64url collation sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(long _idNum)
        Returns the URL Base64 encoding of the least significant 60 bits of the given value. The returned value is always a 10 character string.
        Parameters:
        _idNum - the 60 bit unsigned value to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded equivalent of the given number.

      • decode

        public static long decode(java.lang.String _id)
        Decodes the given IntegerDatum string to a long. Note that the given string must be exactly 10 characters long.
        Parameters:
        _id - the IntegerDatum to decode.
        Returns:
        the long value of the given IntegerDatum, decoded.

      • compare

        public static int compare(char _a,
                          char _b)
        Returns -1, 0, or +1 as the given base64url character _a is less than, equal to, or greater than the given base64url character _b, using the base64url collation sequence. Throws IllegalArgumentException if either character is invalid for base64urls.
        Parameters:
        _a - the first comparand
        _b - the second comparand
        Returns:
        the value -1, 0, or +1 as the given base64url character _a is less than, equal to, or greater than the given base64url character _b

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String _a,
                          java.lang.String _b)
        Returns -1, 0, or +1 as the given base64url _a is less than, equal to, or greater than the given base64url _b. Throws IllegalArgumentException if either given string is null, if the given strings aren't of equal length, or if either string contains invalid base64url characters.
        Parameters:
        _a - the first comparand
        _b - the second comparand
        Returns:
        the value -1, 0, or +1 as the given base64url _a is less than, equal to, or greater than the given base64url _b

      • get

        public static int get(char _char)
        Returns the numeric value of the given character, or -1 if the character is invalid.
        Parameters:
        _char - the character to get a numeric value for
        Returns:
        the numeric value of the given character, or -1 if the character is invalid
